wikipedia_page.main: Samuel Cook (1806–1859) was an English watercolour artist.

response: *J. Samuel Cook (born 1983), African-American playwright, journalist and writer

Wightwick also designed the stables, conservatory and kennels as surviving plans reveal. At about the same time the artist Samuel Cook was commission to paint murals on the walls of the staircase of views immediately outside the house.Plymouth Institution and Devon and Cornwall Natural History Society, 1881 Annual Reports and Transactions, p. 393; online reference here Further remodeling of the house was made by the 1st Baron in 1860 when he commissioned Anthony Salvin to make more additions.
